com.clarionmedia.infinitum.orm

Interface Session

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    RestfulJsonSession, RestfulSession, RestfulXmlSession, SqliteSession

    public interface Session

    Represents the lifecycle of an Infinitum persistence service and acts as an interface to a configured application datastore. All database interaction goes through the Session, which also provides an API for creating Criteria and Criteria instances. Session instances should be acquired from an InfinitumOrmContext by calling InfinitumOrmContext.getSession(com.clarionmedia.infinitum.orm.context.InfinitumOrmContext.SessionType) .

    When a Session is acquired, it must be opened by calling open() before any Session operations can be performed. Subsequently, close() should be called to close the persistence service and clean up any resources.

    Session can be configured to be transactional. If autocommit is disabled in infinitum.cfg.xml, a transaction must be opened by calling beginTransaction() and subsequently committed by calling commit(). Transactions, which can be nested, can also be rolled back using rollback(). Transactions are particularly useful for atomic database operations. They are not supported by RestfulSession.

    In order to keep track of transient and persistent entities, Session implements a Session cache. This cache can be configured to recycle automatically in order to reclaim memory in infinitum.cfg.xml. The cache can also be explicitly recycled by invoking recycleCache(). Additionally, the cache size can be modified by calling setCacheSize(int).

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0 03/15/12
    Author:
    Tyler Treat

        The default number of cache entries before eviction occurs.

    • Method Detail

      • open

        Session open()
             throws android.database.SQLException
        Opens the Session for transactions.
        Returns:
        Session to allow chaining
        Throws:
        android.database.SQLException - if the Session cannot be opened

      • close

        Session close()
        Closes the Session and cleans up any resources.
        Returns:
        Session to allow chaining

      • isOpen

        boolean isOpen()
        Indicates if the Session is open.
        Returns:
        true if the Session is open, false if not

      • beginTransaction

        Session beginTransaction()
        Starts a new database transaction. If autocommit is enabled, invoking this method will have no effect. A transaction must be committed or rolled back by calling commit() or rollback(), respectively.
        Returns:
        Session to allow chaining

      • commit

        Session commit()
        Commits the current transaction. This method is idempotent. If no transaction is open or autocommit is enabled, this will have no effect.
        Returns:
        Session to allow chaining

      • rollback

        Session rollback()
        Rolls back the current transaction. This method is idempotent. If no transaction is open or autocommit is enabled, this will have no effect.
        Returns:
        Session to allow chaining

      • isTransactionOpen

        boolean isTransactionOpen()
        Indicates if a transaction is currently open.
        Returns:
        true if a transaction is open, false if not

      • setAutocommit

        Session setAutocommit(boolean autocommit)
        Sets the autocommit value for this Session. If autocommit is enabled, a Session transaction must be initiated by invoking beginTransaction(). A transaction must then be committed or rolled back by calling commit() or rollback(), respectively. If autocommit is disabled, database operations will be committed when they are executed.
        Parameters:
        autocommit - true to enable autocommit, false to disable it
        Returns:
        Session to allow chaining

      • isAutocommit

        boolean isAutocommit()
        Indicates if autocommit is enabled or disabled.
        Returns:
        true if autocommit is enabled, false if not

      • recycleCache

        Session recycleCache()
        Recycles the Session cache, effectively reclaiming its memory.
        Returns:
        Session to allow chaining

      • setCacheSize

        Session setCacheSize(int mCacheSize)
        Sets the Session cache capacity in terms of how many Objects it can store. The cache size dictates when the cache is recycled if it is configured to do so automatically. Once the cache reaches this capacity, it will be recycled. The cache can also be recycled manually by calling SqliteSession.recycleCache(), which will reclaim it regardless of how Infinitum is configured.
        Parameters:
        mCacheSize - the maximum number of Objects the cache can store
        Returns:
        Session to allow chaining

      • getCacheSize

        int getCacheSize()
        Returns the maximum capacity of the Session cache in terms of how many Objects it can store.
        Returns:
        the maximum number of Objects the cache can store

      • cache

        boolean cache(int hash,
            java.lang.Object model)
        Caches the given model identified by the given hash code.
        Parameters:
        hash - the hash code which maps to the model
        model - the Object to cache
        Returns:
        true if the model was cached, false if not

      • checkCache

        boolean checkCache(int hash)
        Indicates if the session cache contains the given hash code.
        Parameters:
        hash - the hash code to check for
        Returns:
        true if the cache contains the hash code, false if not

      • searchCache

        java.lang.Object searchCache(int hash)
        Returns the model with the given hash code from the session cache.
        Parameters:
        hash - the hash code of the model to retrieve
        Returns:
        the model Object identified by the given hash code or null if no such entity exists in the cache

      • save

        long save(java.lang.Object model)
          throws InfinitumRuntimeException
        Persists the given Object to the database. This method is not idempotent, meaning if the record already exists, a new one will attempt to persist.
        Parameters:
        model - Object to persist to the database
        Returns:
        the row ID of the newly inserted record, or -1 if the insert failed
        Throws:
        InfinitumRuntimeException - if the model is marked transient

      • update

        boolean update(java.lang.Object model)
               throws InfinitumRuntimeException
        Updates the given Object in the database.
        Parameters:
        model - Object to update in the database
        Returns:
        true if the updated succeeded, false if it failed
        Throws:
        InfinitumRuntimeException - if the model is marked transient

      • delete

        boolean delete(java.lang.Object model)
               throws InfinitumRuntimeException
        Deletes the given Object from the database if it exists.
        Parameters:
        model - Object to delete from the database
        Returns:
        true if the record was deleted, false otherwise
        Throws:
        InfinitumRuntimeException - if the model is marked transient

      • saveOrUpdate

        long saveOrUpdate(java.lang.Object model)
                  throws InfinitumRuntimeException
        Persists the given Object to the database, or, if it already exists, updates the record.
        Parameters:
        model - Object to save or update in the database
        Returns:
        the row ID of the newly inserted row, 0 if the row was updated, or -1 if the operation failed.
        Throws:
        InfinitumRuntimeException - if the model is marked transient

      • saveOrUpdateAll

        int saveOrUpdateAll(java.util.Collection<? extends java.lang.Object> models)
                    throws InfinitumRuntimeException
        Persists or updates the entire collection of Objects in the database.
        Parameters:
        models - Objects to save or update in the database
        Returns:
        the number of records saved or updated
        Throws:
        InfinitumRuntimeException - if one or more of the models is marked transient

      • saveAll

        int saveAll(java.util.Collection<? extends java.lang.Object> models)
            throws InfinitumRuntimeException
        Persists the entire collection of Objects to the database.
        Parameters:
        models - Objects to persist to the database
        Returns:
        the number of records saved
        Throws:
        InfinitumRuntimeException - if one or more of the models is marked transient

        Parameters:
        models - Objects to delete from the database
        Returns:
        the number of records deleted
        Throws:
        InfinitumRuntimeException - if one or more of the models is marked transient

      • load

        <T> T load(java.lang.Class<T> c,
         java.io.Serializable id)
       throws InfinitumRuntimeException,
              java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns an instance of the given persistent model Class as identified by the specified primary key or null if no such entity exists.
        Parameters:
        c - the Class of the persistent instance to load
        id - the primary key value of the persistent instance to load
        Returns:
        the persistent instance
        Throws:
        InfinitumRuntimeException - if the specified Class is marked transient
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if an invalid primary key is provided

      • execute

        Session execute(java.lang.String sql)
                throws SQLGrammarException
        Executes the given SQL non-query on the database, meaning no result is expected.
        Parameters:
        sql - the SQL query to execute
        Returns:
        Session to allow chaining
        Throws:
        SQLGrammarException - if the SQL was formatted incorrectly

      • createCriteria

        Creates a new Criteria instance for the given persistent entity Class.

        entityClass - the persistent Class being queried for
        Returns:
        Criteria for entityClass

      • registerTypeAdapter

        <T> Session registerTypeAdapter(java.lang.Class<T> type,
                              TypeAdapter<T> adapter)
        Registers the given TypeAdapter for the specified Class with this Session instance. The TypeAdapter allows a Field of this type to be mapped to a database column. Registering a TypeAdapter for a Class which already has a TypeAdapter registered for it will result in the previous TypeAdapter being overridden.
        Parameters:
        type - the Class this TypeAdapter is for
        adapter - the TypeAdapter to register
        Returns:
        Session to allow chaining

      • getRegisteredTypeAdapters

        java.util.Map<java.lang.Class<?>,? extends TypeAdapter<?>> getRegisteredTypeAdapters()
        Returns a Map containing all TypeAdapter instances registered with this Session and the Class instances in which they are registered for.
        Returns:
        {@code Map, ? extends TypeAdapter>

      • registerDeserializer

        <T> Session registerDeserializer(java.lang.Class<T> type,
                               Deserializer<T> deserializer)
        Registers the given Deserializer for the given Class type. Registering a Deserializer for a Class which already has a Deserializer registered for it will result in the previous Deserializer being overridden.
        Parameters:
        type - the Class to associate this deserializer with
        deserializer - the Deserializer to use when deserializing Objects of the given type
        Returns:
        Session to allow chaining
